body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Eg: Gambling brings him to ruin.
He was gloating over the ruin of his rival.
sentences.chinese: 他幸灾乐祸地看著他的对手身败名裂。

sentences.english: Of course, they will be broken in the end.
sentences.chinese: 当然，最终的结果就是身败名裂。

sentences.english: When the bank broke , many people were ruined.
sentences.chinese: 当银行破产时，许多人跟着身败名裂。

sentences.english: His downfall was caused by gambling and drink.
sentences.chinese: 他的身败名裂是由赌博和酗酒造成的。

sentences.english: The scandal finally led to his downfall.
sentences.chinese: 这桩丑闻最终使他身败名裂。

sentences.english: Lin was subsequently fired, his reputation left in tatters
sentences.chinese: 林嘉祥随后被开除，身败名裂。
她把自己搞得身败名裂。

sentences.english: His treacherous actions brought down ruin on himself.
sentences.chinese: 他的背叛行径使他身败名裂。

sentences.english: I'm proud of Romania for producing such an infamous character.
sentences.chinese: 为罗马尼亚如此身败名裂的角色感到骄傲。
